definitions.definition: To pay attention to a sound or speech.
definitions.example: Please listen carefully as I explain.  I like to listen to music.

definitions.definition: To expect or wait for a sound, such as a signal.
definitions.example: You should listen for the starting gun.

definitions.definition: To accept advice or obey instruction; to agree or assent.
definitions.example: Listen, the only reason I yelled at you was because I was upset, OK?  Good children listen to their parents.

definitions.definition: To hear (something or someone), to pay attention to.
Of something or someone that listens.
definitions.example: Any listening person can tell she's lying.

definitions.definition: Of something that is used in order to hear or to improve the ability to hear.
definitions.example: He could hear better when he used his listening device.

definitions.definition: Of an action that is performed with caution and attention to sounds.

definitions.example: OK, students, today we're going to do a couple of listenings about the environment, then a reading about crime.

definitions.definition: Skill or ability of perceiving spoken language.
definitions.example: You can improve your listening well by watching English-language films.
